edu.thangiah.interceptor

Class AuthenticationInterceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.thangiah.interceptor.AuthenticationInterceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor, java.io.Serializable

    public class AuthenticationInterceptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor
    AuthenticationInterceptor implements all authentication functionality for the user authentication system. It determines whether a user is currently logged in, and manages session information.
    Author:
    Kelly Smith
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • intercept

        public java.lang.String intercept(com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionInvocation invocation)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called by any action that invokes the authIntercept stack. It validates the current logged in user and maintains session information. Additionally it also performs permission validation on each page and redirects to a permission denied page on failure.
        Specified by:
        intercept in interface com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • calculatePermissions

        public java.lang.String calculatePermissions(java.lang.String actionName)
        Determines whether the current logged in user has permission to view the specified action using the permissions framework.
        Parameters:
        actionName - A unique identifier for the action being accessed. These action names are stored in the database in the permissions table.
        Returns:
        SUCCESS or PERMISSION_DENIED
